Chief Complaint:
Sore throat.

History of Present Illness:
2 days sore throat with low-grade fever. No cough. No dyspnea.

Past Medical History:
No chronic illness reported.

Medications:
None.

Allergies:
NKDA.

Physical Exam:
General: well appearing, no acute distress.
HEENT: mild pharyngeal erythema, no exudate.
Lungs: clear to auscultation bilaterally.

Assessment:
Most consistent with viral pharyngitis.
Low suspicion for bacterial infection at this time.

Plan:
Supportive care and hydration. Acetaminophen PRN.
Return if worsening symptoms or persistent fever.
